description.narrative: Project Activities 1. Conduct an analysis to identify economic, cultural, and social barriers that women and men with intersectional identities face in their daily lives. 2. Organize awareness events and sessions on human rights and women’s empowerment and provide training to the beneficiaries through the community leaders to the 500-targeted disadvantaged and marginalized households. Though constant follow-up, monitoring and discussions, the beneficiaries will slowly internalize how to claim their rights, entitlements and voice in their family, community and market. 3. Provide technical, managerial and entrepreneurial training on cassava production to 250 disadvantaged and marginalized households and integrated poultry farming. 4.Provide technical, managerial and entrepreneurial training on integrated poultry farming to 250 disadvantaged and marginalized households. 5.Develop two vaccinators with feed seller and one egg hatching entrepreneur from the targeted community and create linkages. 6.Strengthen capacity of local input sellers, service providers, collectors and traders and create linkage with targeted beneficiaries. 7. Facilitate contract farming agreement between beneficiary groups and interested private s

The project will help break down deep-rooted barriers preventing socio-economic empowerment of disadvantaged and marginalized women and men with multiple intersectional identities so that they can have control over their lives and play an influential role in society as well as in the supply chain. The proposed activities will increase participation, voice and capacity of target beneficiaries and expand their opportunities in the supply chains.
